page.title: 08CONSERVATION AROUND MIDHURST
page.content: There are many miles of footpaths and bridleways.A group of people walk each footpath once a year to keep them open.There is very little river or stream pollution and little pollution of the air as there is no heavy industry.There is no conflict between farmers and conservationists.Farmers have not destroyed hedgerows which shelter wildlife and they trim their hedges in the late Summer to avoid nesting and hatching periods.They are careful when they spray crops not to affect wildlife.Most farm buildings are original ones used long ago.Local animals include deer,badgers and foxes.Everyone is keen to preserve them.As there is a great deal of woodland and common there is a wide variety of flora and fauna.Local groups work hard to ensure that the habitat is not interfered with.
